src.app.db_helper module¶

Database utilities for working with applicant records.

This module provides helpers for:

  • Checking existing result IDs in the database.

  • Inserting new records (with URL uniqueness).

  • Reading/writing JSON files for intermediate pipeline steps.

It depends on the global PostgreSQL connection pool defined in db.

src.app.db_helper.existing_rids() → set[str][source]¶

Return the set of reference IDs (rid) already stored.

Extracts IDs from the url field in the applicants table.

Returns:

Set of unique reference IDs.

Return type:

set[str]

src.app.db_helper.insert_records_by_url(records: list[dict], data_type) → int[source]¶

Insert applicant records into the database.

Uses ON CONFLICT (url) DO NOTHING to skip duplicates (uniqueness is enforced by url).

Parameters:

  • records (list[dict]) – List of record dictionaries to insert.

  • data_type (callable) – Function that converts a record dict into a list of values matching the schema.

Returns:

Number of rows successfully inserted.

Return type:

int

src.app.db_helper.write_json(path: Path, rows: list[dict]) → None[source]¶

Write a list of dicts to a pretty-printed JSON file.

Parameters:

  • path (pathlib.Path) – Path to the file to write.

  • rows (list[dict]) – List of row dicts to serialize.

Returns:

None

Return type:

NoneType

src.app.db_helper.read_json(path: Path) → list[dict][source]¶

Read a JSON or JSONL file into a list of dicts.

Supports both JSON (array of objects) and JSON Lines (one object per line).

Parameters:

path (pathlib.Path) – Path to the JSON or JSONL file.

Returns:

List of records parsed from the file.

Return type:

list[dict]
